results.title: The People with love and faith
results.creator_credit: Kwang Hwa Mass Communications, Cheng Yi Communications, Weng Jeng-Yih and Ko-Lun Huang
results.brief_description: This program serves as a testimonial to the endeavours of the Taiwanese to rebuild their society: economically, socially and culturally. It focuses on the achievements of individuals, each of whom have contributed to the successful relocation of their society onto the Island of Taiwan. It was once said that “Taiwan is like the oyster in the Pacific. It turns sand into pearls.” For the filmmakers, this national pride provided a source of inspiration, in the hope that others will share their sentiments.

results.title: The People of Weipa South
results.brief_description: A look at the benefits and problems that the Comalco Mining Company has brought to the Aborigines and Island people of Weipa South.

results.title: The People of Parliament
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Geoffrey Barnes and Ian Host
results.brief_description: This documentary explains the functions of Parliament by following the parliamentary day of two senators (Bob Collins and Kay Patterson) and two members of the House of Representatives (Kathy Sullivan and Stephen Martin). Parliamentarians are shown at work in their offices, at meetings of Parliamentary committees and at party political meetings as well as participating in debate in their respective houses.

results.title: The People mover
results.brief_description: A promotional film on a new type of twin hull ferry designed and built by a Hobart firm. It was built initially to transport people across the Derwent but is also available for overseas sales.

results.title: The Pentridge experience. Part 2
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Commission and John Abbott
results.brief_description: Examines problems of prison officers, both within the prison and outside. Also shows the difficulties faced by prisoners and their families through lack of facilities for contact visits. Includes a condemnation of the continued existence of H Division and its medieval labour yards. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: The Pentridge experience. Part 1
results.creator_credit: Chequerboard, Australian Broadcasting Commission and John Abbott
results.brief_description: Shows the grim conditions of the reception prison, where men awaiting trial are retained, and the classification process that convicted prisoners undergo. Interviews with prisoners discuss the lack of privacy and associated problems, and the new “term of natural life” sentence. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: The Penguins of Macquarie Island [B&W]
results.brief_description: Observes the habits of the various species of penguins which live on Macquarie Island. The film was compiled from record material photographed by members of the Australian National Antarctic Research Expedition and officers of the CSIRO. The penguins are seen marching to and from their rookeries, assembling on the beach, looking after their young, and at play. Various features, which distinguish one species from another, are illustrated.

results.title: The Penguin Video
results.brief_description: Phillip Island, with its rugged coastline, windswept beaches and sparkling water, attracts over a million visitors a year. From all over the world people come to witness Australia’s famous Penguin Parade. Peter Hosking is your guide to Phillip Island, a haven for over 200 species of birds and wildlife, including koalas, kangaroos, wallabies, wombats and fur seals. As the sun goes below the horizon, the world’s smallest penguins gather off-shore in large groups, waiting for the safety of darkness. The stage is set. The first come ashore and the parade of the little penguins begins! Rated: G

results.title: The Penetrating eye
results.creator_credit: Eli Lilly and Company and Wexler Film Productions
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the functioning of a scanning electron microscope and shows how an electron beam, instead of light waves, is used to produce revealing images of microscopically sized specimens. Scanning electron microscope photographs of biological specimens are show and interpreted as to the new information and technique.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Eli Lilly and Company and Wexler Film Productions
